Example

Alice, Bob and Clarissa are involved at a meeting. Alice looks at Bob and Bob looks at Clarissa. Alice is married but Clarissa is not.

Is Bob married?

Prove that a married person looks at an unmarried one.

Solution

We do not know if Bob is married or unmarried. Therefore we have to consider both cases in our proof.

Proof:

Note that either Bob is married or unmarried, so there are two cases.

  1. Bob is married: In this case then when Bob looks at Clarissa a married person is looking at an unmarried one.
  2. Bob is unmarried: In this case when Alice looks at Bob a married person is looking at an unmarried one.

In both cases a married person is looking at an unmarried one therefore a married person always looks at an unmarried one.
